SEARCH
Package validation

Class ArgumentValidator

java.lang.Object
validation.ArgumentValidator
public class ArgumentValidator extends Object
Class responsible for validating and parsing command-line arguments related to the game's configuration such as algorithm, type, units, orientation, and battlefield size.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ArgumentValidator(String[] args)
    Constructs an ArgumentValidator with the given command-line arguments.

  • Constructor Details

    • ArgumentValidator

      public ArgumentValidator(String[] args)
      Constructs an ArgumentValidator with the given command-line arguments. It automatically validates and sets the fields accordingly.
      Parameters:
      args - the command-line arguments passed to the program

  • Method Details

    • getAlgorithm

      public char getAlgorithm()
      Gets the algorithm symbol.
      Returns:
      the character symbol representing the sorting algorithm

    • getType

      public char getType()
      Gets the type symbol.
      Returns:
      the character symbol representing the troop display type

    • getUnits

      public List<Integer> getUnits()
      Gets the list of troop units parsed from arguments.
      Returns:
      list of integers representing troop units

    • getDisposition

      public char getDisposition()
      Gets the disposition character, indicating troop arrangement type ('u' or 'r').
      Returns:
      disposition character

    • getOrientation

      public char getOrientation()
      Gets the orientation symbol.
      Returns:
      the character symbol representing troop orientation

    • getFieldSize

      public int getFieldSize()
      Gets the battlefield size.
      Returns:
      integer representing the size of one side of the battlefield (assumed square)

    • validateAlgorithm

      public void validateAlgorithm()
      Validates and sets the sorting algorithm based on argument key "a".

    • validateType

      public void validateType()
      Validates and sets the type based on argument key "t".

    • validateUnits

      public void validateUnits()
      Validates and sets the troop units based on argument keys "u" or "r". Also sets the disposition character accordingly.

    • validateOrientation

      public void validateOrientation()
      Validates and sets the orientation based on argument key "o".

    • validateFieldSize

      public void validateFieldSize()
      Validates and sets the battlefield field size based on argument key "f".

    • getValueKey

      public String getValueKey(String key)
      Retrieves the value associated with a given argument key from the arguments array. If the key is not found or the value is missing, returns the key string itself.
      Parameters:
      key - the argument key to look for (e.g., "a", "t", "u")
      Returns:
      the value associated with the key or the key itself if not found or invalid

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the validated arguments for display.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      formatted string describing the algorithm, type, troops, orientation, and battlefield size
